page.title: 18Entertainment in Bilston
page.content: Entertainment in the area is limited as there is no longer a cinema or theatre. Many townsfolk visit the local Bingo Hall. Dancing,for both young and old, is often held in local schools and community halls. "Black Country" evenings are a regular entertainment for the locality. These evenings consist of traditional food like grey peas, peas pudding,black pudding, faggots, and of course,beer. Comedians tell stories and jokes about typical "Black Country" people, particularly "Aynuk" and "Ali". Churches and places of Religion also provide places where people can meet socially. Near to the centre of Bilston are Holy Trinity R.C. Church, St.Mary's and St.Leonards C of E Churches, The Methodist Church, Baptist Church and Sihk Temple. Activities include Mothers & Toddlers, Senior Citizens & Uniformed Groups.
